docs.abstract: Former New England Patriots tight end Aaron Hernandez pleads not guilty to first-degree murder charge after his indictment in the killing of friend Odin Lloyd, who authorities say was shot five times; other football news noted.

docs.abstract: New York Giants are hopeful that receiver Victor Cruz will recover from bruised heel in time for season opener against Dallas Cowboys, but defensive end Jason Pierre-Paul remains questionable.

docs.snippet: The cry grows for more equitable treatment of college football and men’s basketball players....
docs.lead_paragraph: The cry grows for more equitable treatment of college football and men’s basketball players.
docs.abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column notes Time Magazine is only the latest voice to join call for pay and equitable treatment for college football and basketball players; holds case of Texas A&M quarterback Johnny Manziel, who was penalized for signing memorabilia, has become tipping point in public perception of the absurdity of NCAA rules.
